deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text:
This obtains the signer of a hash given its signature.
 Note that a returned address of 0 means that the signature is invalid,
 and should be treated as such.

params._amount: the number of tokens to send
params._data: the data field for the operatorSend operation, supplied by the authority
params._nonce: a unique field for a given (_token, _holder, _recipient, _amount, _nonce) supplied by the authority
params._token: the address of the token contract

params._amount: the number of tokens to send
params._data: the data field for the operatorSend operation, supplied by the authority
params._nonce: a unique field for a given (_token, _holder, _recipient, _amount, _nonce) supplied by the authority
params._signature: the signature supplied by the authority
params._token: the address of the token contract

hashForSend(address,address,address,uint.notice: This generates the hash that is signed by the holder to authorise a send.

send(address,address,address,uint256,byt.notice: send tokens from one account to another using the signature as the authority. The signature is created by the holder and signs a hash of the (_token, _holder, _recipient, _amount, _nonce) tuple as created by hashForSend().
